intro: Faucaria bosscheana var. haagei, commonly known as the Cape Hottentot, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features compact, rosette-shaped foliage with thick, fleshy leaves that are typically blue-green in color. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires ample sunlight to maintain its vibrant coloration. Due to its slow growth and ornamental appeal, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
